reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at the De Russie for 2 nights in July. From the beginning the experience was very pleasing. The front desk staff were very efficient and friendly and offered us welcome drinks whilst our room was being prepared, as we had arrived early.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Rome

reviews.text: The hotel's best feature is the beautiful private garden with lush palm trees, Orange trees and fountains. The bar staff were very helpful and friendly, and the head bar man has won several awards for his cocktails. I watched him making a Martini and it was certainly a delicious looking work of art!
reviews.title: Wellness center 'watch' out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Classic Double room overlooking the garden (try to request a garden view at the time of booking). The spa elevator was right next to our room which I was a little worried about, but we never heard any noise from it during our stay. The decor was tasteful and the room was not too overstated. There were complimentary bottles of sparkling and still water, which were replaced during the turndown service.
reviews.title: Awful service at this over priced hotel

reviews.text: The Spa is large and has 7 treatment rooms, a hydrotherapy pool, sauna and steam room. There is also a small gym which looks well equipped. The hydrotherapy was lovely, more of a giant jacuzzi, I could have spent all day in there! The facilities are free for guests to use.
reviews.title: One of the best luxury hotels we have stayed in

reviews.text: The breakfast is a continental breakfast, with a selection of breads, cakes, croissants, cheeses, meat, smoked salmon, yoghurts, fresh fruit, Free pour sparkling wine and preserves. There is also a cooked breakfast available to order, in fact I imagine the hotel will cook you pretty much anything you fancy for breakfast!
reviews.title: Very good experience
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel, excellent service, superb housekeeping, room service, concierge. Excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite on arrival. We stayed on the second floor. The Hotel is noisy, not from street noise, but noise from construction in the spa (we didn't know about this in advance) and carts etc going through the halls below seemed to reverberate through the walls. There was also some jack hammering going on a few of the mornings. I guess they've got to do construction type stuff at some time during the year. Even with ear plugs, I had trouble sleeping. The beds are a bit stiff as are the sheets unlike other 5 star hotels where I've stayed -- if you like this style, no problem.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

likes.disliked: — Not able to enjoy the views because no umbrella/awning provided against heat of sun. It simply was not worth the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is also amazingly expensive, especially for Americans with weak dollar -- simple tossed salad 18 Euro approximately $27. Ouch.
reviews.title: Somewhat Confused by the Bad Reviews...It Was Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the Hotel, the location, but probably would look into other options until the dollar recovers and would also seek to book a room on a higher floor.
reviews.title: Does not worth it !

reviews.text: Our first stay at a Rocco Forte hotel and having seen the brochure and the website we were really excited at the prospect. We booked the third most expensive suite (Popolo) which overlooks the Piazza del Popolo and after all the hype, we were distinctly underwhelmed! So much so that when we were shown to our suite we had to ask if it was indeed the Popolo Suite! The modern decor was pleasant but all much smaller than we expected. The bathroom - far from being superior - was small with a shower within the bath, no separate shower!! Very poor. We suggest they take a look at the Spirit Suites at Gleneagles in Scotland if they want to know about superior bathrooms!!
reviews.title: 4th return in 5 years

likes.disliked: — a little worn and dated by now

reviews.text: I've stayed at many hotels in Rome, from 3 to 5 star, and The Russie was the first one that was flawless.
reviews.title: Rome's Finest
Good pricey hotel
reviews.text: I checked out of the Intercontinental, when I'd had enough of the inconsistant service there, and I hauled my bags down to The Russie.

When I called to inquire about availability, I was quickly impressed when the reservations manager offered me a wonderfully reduced rate. I'm affraid that if I were to have been offered a rack rate I would have had to find other accomodations. However, my reduced rate, to my amazement, in no way changed the level of service that was given to me.
reviews.title: waist of money

reviews.text: Arrivng at the du Russie with a scheduled airport pickup is 140 Euro one way, when arranged through the concierge. However one you sit in the Mercedes Minivan, you will find a small broshure of the subcontrator, that tell you the oneway is 60 Euros. Nice Markup... One you stepped inside that quite hideaway right at the piazza du popolo, you are welcomed very personally and checked in by an receptionalist in your room or suite. Try to get a room or suite that faced the garden, as all street rooms may be a but loed when you are used to sleep with open windows. Rooms are all spacious and clean, bathrooms and walkin closet are high standard. With a price of 980 Euro a night for the deluxe room, you may expect the spa - fitness access and internet included; not at the du rossie, where they charge you 11 Euros per fitness and 20 Euros per 24 hours (single MAC adress) internet access. Try the breakfast in the beautiful gardens, that is buffet style and of very high quality. We do not recommend the restaurant of lunch or dinner. For both occasions the same menue cards and not very creative food. You better want to go just a view steps to an nice italien restaurant. For dinner most concierge recommendations were not "inside" at all. Stay with your restaurant guide and book for the in places way in advance from home.
reviews.title: Top Quality + perfect location, but....

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 5-night stay at the de Russie. In summary, the location was terrific, the bar / outdoor cafe was a wonderful oasis (filled with Romans enjoying cocktails before dinner), the service was pretty good though a bit inconsistent (not surprising to us given our other experiences in large European cities), and the rooms were fine: clean, decently sized (we've heard some of the rooms in Rome can be tiny), subtly decorated and quiet at night. On the downside, it wasn't a great value (around $700 / night) though comparable to other 5-star rated hotels in Rome, the restaurant is very good for breakfast but I wouldn't have dinner there (if breakfast is not included, it is incredibly expensive, almost 60 euros for two), and the spa is ok but not great. All in all, we would definitely stay at the de Russie again when in Rome; the only other hotel we would like to visit is the Hassler (we learned from some locals that the private apartments there are terrific).
reviews.title: One of the top hotels in Rome

reviews.text: One of the best attributes of the de Russie is its location, rivaled only by the Hassler at the top of the Spanish Steps. The Piazza del Popolo is a popular area for chic Romans to stroll about in the evenings, and there are two outdoor cafes on the piazza that are perfect for people watching over steaming cups of caffe (espresso of course, sweetened like the Romans take it!). The exceptional Villa Borghese gallery and park are located adjacent to the hotel in the hillside; we would recommend you take a taxi to the villa and then enjoy a leisurely stroll back to the hotel (downhill). The de Russie is steps from the top shopping in Rome (via Condotti, via Bourgogne and via Fontanella Borghese) and right around the corner from via Margutta, a quaint cobblestoned street filled with high-end antique dealers. The hotel is also conveniently located to most of the major sites (Vatican, Forum, etc). We hired a private guide (a university professor of art history) and driver for a few days to see the sites and would highly recommend it (expensive, but worthwhile).
reviews.title: chic and expensive
A chic hotel in an excellent location
reviews.text: We spent much time in the hotel's gardens and outdoor courtyard enjoying a leisurely breakfast or cocktails before dinner. The de Russie martini is very smooth and the briny caviar is the perfect complement. The champagne drinks were also quite memorable -- strawberries were in season so the rossini was quite good. The munchies accompanying the drinks were surprisingly memorable ... giant capers and a bounty of olives, freshly baked focaccia, chips and other tasty morsels. We would highly recommend a trip to the bar to any visitor to Rome.

reviews.title: POOR service,AVERAGE rooms, GREAT location
reviews.text: As for restaurants (always an important part of any visit to Italy), the concierge was ok but not great. We found the best recommendations came from friends and locals whom we met, though the concierge scored a huge hit with Quinzi & Gabrieli, the top seafood restaurant in Rome. Again, very expensive but excellent ... the carpaccio and raw appetizer is not be missed. Other hits were Al Moro, Dal Bolognese (right around the corner from the hotel), La Taverna in the ghetto and Matrinacella (sp?). For our next trip, Agate e Romeo and La Pergola are on our hit list.

reviews.title: Luxurious, gorgeous and welcoming
reviews.text: This hotel combines cool style with a genuinely warm service. If you like your interior design classical and sleek rather than baroque and cluttered, you will love the Hotel de Russie. The staff are very efficient and keen to help you enjoy your stay however they can - the housekeeping staff are like a SWOT team descending on your room every time you leave, the concierges and front desk people manage to make what could be a rather imposing environment perfectly relaxing and the restaurant staff are efficient and welcoming. The garden makes this hotel very special even without the carefully thought out interiors and the super service. Yes its expensive, but you get value for all that money!

reviews.title: De Russie is a Disappointment
reviews.text: I went for a romantic weekend, and really couldn't fault the whole experience. A perfect retreat from the bustle of the city streets whilst keeping a uniquely Roman flavour.

From the very first moment we entered the cold reception of De Russie, we know something was wrong. We were received bruskly as if we were a nuisance to the reception staff and carted off to a scuffed-up room. Every run-in we had with staff (besides the concierge), was a disappointment. Let me say that we are not frumpy tourists without a clue... we are experienced world travelers that expect certain basic graces from a "5-Star" hotel. You would hope that each staff member has at least graduated from a "Hospitality 101" course. Not so at the De Russie -- these are amateur hosts hoping to coast on their cool reputation.
reviews.title: Shabby Chic?

likes.disliked: — Felt a little cold, not inviting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the hotel for you if you want to flash your new Dolce and Gabbana outfit in the bar area, but if you appreciate true luxury and fine service and the feeling of being welcomed.. stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Romantic stay in Rome

likes.liked: — The terrace for dinner and the room
likes.disliked: — too much street noise with windows open, poor conceirge service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently spent 4 nights at The Russie in Rome. When I first checked in I was given a very small room however, after I complained I was given another room which was larger and beautiful.
reviews.title: Luxury , Luxury , Luxury

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, but very overpriced. The rooms are adequate, but not what I would consider luxurious, in need of a paint job, and quite small. The service was good, although the concierge was a tad condescending, which I do not appreciate as a seasoned traveler. The bar is off-limits, as all cocktails are 20 euro ($28 at today's rate), and are small and weak. This hotel has a reputation for housing celebs, but it's in need of updates. The gym was nice, as well as the spa area. Breakfast buffet had many selections, catering both to US and local tastes. I stayed at the Art Hotel last year which was 300 euro per night and not much different from the de Russie priced at 750 euro per night. Drop the rates and I would return, otherwise try other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Not for the Recessionista! Overpriced!

reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure to stay with Forte Hotels in both Rome and Florence this past April. We purchased our 6 night hotel package on Luxurylink.com. Our package included 3 nights at the Savoy in Florence and 3 nights at the De Russie in Rome. It was an exceptional value considering the state of the euro vs the dollar at the time (04/08).
reviews.title: De Russie Devine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To say we were thrilled with our accommodations at both 5 star hotels is an understatement. The De Russie in particular was stellar. The hotel is in a fabulous location. Steps away from major sights, the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of many fine restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Only one observation; otherwise fabulous

likes.disliked: — Price is about 15 per cent too high.

reviews.text: Our spacious room featured a king sized bed, sitting area, oversized marble bathroom, luxurious bedding and tasteful decor. Clean lines, art, and fine furnishings made our stay so special. Our room was located on hotel's top floor, and overlooked the walls of the Borghese Gardens and the private outdoor garden/restaurant and terraces of the hotel. In a bustling city like Rome, this quiet and calm green oasis provided a relaxing haven. The view from our balcony was magnificent.
reviews.title: Superb in every sense of the word

likes.liked: — The room, it was to die for

reviews.text: The Hotel De Russie also features an excellent spa which features a lovely indoor heated and jetted pool. We booked massages and felt totally pampered.
reviews.title: Incredible -- don't understand the complaints
dont stay here
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three nights at this over priced second rate hotel with first rate prices.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful setting
reviews.text: The hotel was dirty, the restraunt was beyond aweful and outragiously expensive. They were so incompetent, they messed up our breakfast order two days in a row and all we ordered was eggs. The last straw though was our experience with the conceirge. We waited in line patiently while he hit on two attractive italian women. When it was our turn, he was so contemptuous and nasty, we ended up just walking away. It was obvious he, like many other people in this hotel and city for that matter, hated americans, but we assumed since we were guests in the hotel, we would at least get some decent service. We have never been treated so poorly and with such contempt. Aside from that, they amusingly all recommended the same reastraunt over and over again when we asked for dinner recommendations, we went to that restraunt to check it out and even though all the other restraunts in the area were packed, this one was totally empty which obviously sent up a red flag. These were just some of the things we found annoying. At close to a thousand dollars a night, this was unacceptable. The icing on the cake is the hotel called us a cab to the airport and told us the cab ride was a fixed rate and when we got to the airport, the cab driver tried to take us for ten etra euros muttering something about the meter, even though there was no meter. Perfect ending to a horrible trip. Rome sucks.

reviews.title: Romatic and lovely
reviews.text: This hotel essentially ruined our vacation. We are writing this review in hopes of helping other travelers avoid this miserable hotel with their miserable staff. One has to wonder that if they hate americans so much, why waste our time accepting our bookings and just do us the courtesy of lying and saying they are booked.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: Hotel de Russie is in a perfect position, near everything. It has a wonderful "Roman Holiday" feel: The courtyard is perfect for breakfast, and the aquatic baths (note no pool) is a great place to relax after a hard day sightseeing. Pre dinner drinks at the hotel is a perfect start to the evening.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Service was excellent and attentive.
Upon arrival was given a room which had soiled walls, a chipped tub and spots on the marble floor around the toilet that appeared to be urine stains. Not a great way to start.
reviews.title: Losing Its Polish!
Just a Great Experience..
reviews.text: Hotel sought to charge me 100 Euros per night more than the agreed upon rate negotiated by Amex.

Breakfast on the terrace: beautiful, lush setting with very average service (mixup with the decaf vs regular coffee, no silverware provided for the coffee, an odor of beer/garbage by the first table provided, etc.)
reviews.title: Wahou...excellent hotel

reviews.text: Overall: great location, spacious rooms (by European standards) with even more spacious baths by EU standards. However, the polish is clearly missing from the service and the common areas need attention (simple maintenance, painting, carpet cleaning etc.).
reviews.title: my favorite hotel in the wordl

reviews.text: Usually we travel for b&b, guest houses and similar. And often we come in italy for our vacations (at the moment we are still here).
reviews.title: Another Rocco Forte Success
